Founders of Delhi

The Tomara dynasty is credited with founding the city of 'Dhillika' (modern Delhi). King Anangpal Tomar built the Lal Kot fort in the 11th century, where the Qutub Minar complex is located. He also established the Iron Pillar here.

тЪФя╕П
Rise of the Chauhans

The Tomars were initially feudatories of the Pratiharas. Later, they came into conflict with the Chauhans (Chahamanas). In the mid-12th century, Vigraharaja Chauhan defeated the Tomars and captured Delhi, but the Tomars were allowed to rule as feudatories. Prithviraj Chauhan, considered the last Hindu emperor, was related to the Tomar dynasty through his mother.

ЁЯМК
Legacy

Anangpal built Surajkund (an ancient reservoir) and Anangtal, showcasing his engineering skills. The Tomar rule is an important chapter in the history of Delhi.
